class_description:
The script terms first and front specify the object with index 0, while last specifies the object with index of count-1. A negative index indicates a location by counting backward from the last object in the collection.
You don’t normally subclass NSIndexSpecifier.

return_description: Initialized NSIndexSpecifier object with its index property set to objectIndex.

Methods.method_description: Initializes an allocated NSIndexSpecifier object with a class description, container specifier, collection key, and object index.
Methods.method_declar: init(containerClassDescription classDesc: NSScriptClassDescription, containerSpecifier container: NSScriptObjectSpecifier?, key property: String, index: Int)

Vars.var_description: Sets the value of the receiver’s index property.
